strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_low>*: Welcome to Argonia, kingdom of His Majesty, King Clavius!
<se_def>*: King Clavius is an excellent ruler. Under his leadership, Argonia can't fail to prosper.
<se_def>*: But it's a bit worrying to think how things will go when it's time for Prince Charmles to take over. Imagine him in charge of politics!
<se_high>*: I can hardly believe it! It seems Prince Charmles has been engaged from the minute he was born!

<se_high>*: His fiancée is the Princess of a country on
the other side of the ocean, called Trodain.
People say she's a real beauty.
<se_def>*: What was that? Have I seen a suspicious<->looking man called Dhoulmagus dressed up as a jester!?
<se_def>*: No, I think I would've remembered someone like that! Is he a travelling entertainer or something?
<se_low>*: I can hardly keep the smile off me face durin' the bazaar! The place gets packed and my sales go through the roof! Ha ha hah!
<se_def>*: There's a town to the northwest of here, famous for its casino. Baccarat, it's called.

<se_def>*: The casino's a real draw for tourists,
but it's suddenly been closed down.
I wonder what's going on?
<se_def>*: Prince Charmles loves a good gamble when he has the chance.<page>*: He often sneaks out of the castle and heads over to Baccarat for the odd game or two.
<se_def>*: He must be feelin' a bit peeved now though, eh, what with the casino there bein' closed down!

<se_def>*: Hmm... If I were a criminal, where would
I hide? Is that a joke!? No, no, of course not.
Let's see...

<se_def>*: No, sorry. I've no idea. But if anyone would
know, I bet the bartender in Baccarat would.
He can't get enough of the old gossip.

<se_high>*: When we have the bazaar, people come here from all over the world to sell their things.
The town square gets jam-packed!

<se_def>*: Has there been a murder in town lately!?
Are you mad!?
<se_def>*: King Clavius would never let a thing like that happen! Argonia is the safest place in the world!
<se_high>*: What IS going on over in Baccarat!? A casino where you can't play is like a pub where you can't drink!
<se_high>*: Speaking of drink, that reminds me of the casino bartender. He knows absolutely everything! He's a real one for gossip.
<se_high>*: I was at the casino once and he told me which slot machine pays out the most often!
<se_high>*: If there's ever anything you want to know, just head on over to Baccarat and ask for him.
<se_high>*: The bartender over in Baccarat knows absolutely everything! He's a real one for gossip.
<se_high>*: If there's ever anything you want to know, just head on over to Baccarat and ask for the bartender.

<se_low>*: I came all this way to get a permit for this year's bazaar, but I can't get inside the castle.
Of all the luck!
<se_def>*: Sorry, but I'm afraid I can't let you inside the castle. No one's allowed in or out until Prince Charmles is located.
<se_def>*: If we don't seal up the exits like this, there's a chance he might run away.
<se_def>*: We're under orders to guard the castle exits and make sure Prince Charmles doesn't run away.
<se_low>*: Aren't you a little bit early for the bazaar?
<se_low>*: Oh! You're not a peddler? Well, you look just like one! I had you pegged as the type to come and set up camp here for the duration!
<se_high>*: Do you know why Prince Charmles and Princess Medea were engaged even before they were born?
<se_high>*: Huh, so you've heard already, have you? Well, what a disappointment! I didn't know there was anyone else out there telling that story!
<se_high>*: Well, it's a bit of a long story, but I'm sure you won't mind. Shall I start now?
<se_high>*: Oh, that's a shame. Well, maybe I can tell you another time when you're not in such a hurry.
<se_high>*: Wonderful! Now, listen carefully. The link between the Prince and the Princess goes all the way back to their grandparents' days.
<se_high>*: Long, long ago, Prince Charmles's grandfather hid his identity and set off on a world tour.
<se_high>*: During his travels, he went to the Kingdom of Trodain and fell in love with the Princess.<page>*: But Argonia and Trodain were on very bad terms at the time.
<se_high>*: He wanted to marry her, but he never got his wish because both of their families opposed the match.
<se_high>*: They had no choice but to part, promising each other that one day their children would marry in their place.
<se_high>*: Sadly, they both only had boys, so they died without seeing their promise fulfilled.
<se_high>*: But then his son, King Clavius, decided that he wanted to make his father's wish come true.
<se_high>*: So he approached the King of Trodain and asked that their children be married if a boy and a girl were born to them.

<se_high>*: King Trode agreed to the idea.
Some time later King Clavius fathered a son,
Prince Charmles, while Princess Medea was born to King Trode.
<se_high>*: So, by getting married, they'll be fulfilling their grandparents' wish at last. Sorry to go on a bit, but isn't that a lovely story!?
<se_low>*: There's an ancient ritual here in Argonia, where the Prince has to prove he has what it takes to rule the kingdom after his father.
<se_low>*: He does that by defeating a rare monster called an Argon lizard, and bringing back its jewel as proof of his conquest.
<se_low>*: If he succeeds, he's recognised as the heir to the throne. It's sort of like a coming of age ceremony, I suppose.
<se_def>*: I have to keep my voice down because I don't want to be overheard.<page>*: But I'm more than a little bit worried about the future when I think of Prince Charmles ruling the roost.
<se_def>*: I mean, it's hard to believe he's King Clavius's son with looks like that.<page>*: Clavius is so distinguished and handsome, while Charmles is just, well, charmless really!
<se_def>*: If it was just his looks that weren't up to scratch, it wouldn't matter. But it goes a lot deeper than that...
<se_high>*: Every time my husband opens his mouth, he comes out with something bad about Prince Charmles.<page>*: I can see where he's coming from, but still...
<se_high>*: My master is Chancellor to the King, and he's an extremely important man.
<se_high>*: My only son, Lorenzo, is off on a world tour at the moment.
<se_high>*: It's good to let your children go off and broaden their horizons while they're young.<page>*: I have high hopes for him being a very important man in the future.

<se_high>*: It sounds like Prince Charmles is trying every trick in the book to get out of the initiation.<page>*: Faking illness, shutting himself away,
you name it!
<se_high>*: I suppose you can't really blame him for being scared. He has to take a jewel from one of those huge, fearsome Argon lizards, after all.

<se_high>*: See Lorenzo up on the hill?
He's been disni...dinis...disinherited!
...What does ‘disinherited’ mean!?
<se_low>*: Apparently, Prince Charmles is scared of lizards, so he's trying to avoid doing the initiation. What a sorry state of affairs!

<se_low>*: What with the cowardly Prince and the Chancellor's good-for-nothing son, Lorenzo,
this country's really going to the dogs!
<se_high>*: Did you know that King Clavius had an elder brother called Eltrio?
<se_high>*: Well, apparently, he gave up his title and everything and left Argonia. I don't know why, though.
<se_def>*: This building is used for big events, but there's been nothing much going on lately.
<se_low>*: Welcome to Argonia, kingdom of His Majesty, King Clavius!
<se_low>*: (Yawn...) I'm just about ready to nod off. Time to go home.
<se_low>*: Bet you thought I'd be shut in the evenin', eh!? But I can't get enough of the old wheelin' and dealin'!<page>*: So let's see the colour of yer money, then!
<se_low>*: I can hardly keep the smile off me face durin' the bazaar! The place gets packed and my sales go through the roof! Ha ha hah!
<se_def>*: Hic! There's a town northwest of here, famous for its casino. Hic! Baccarat, it's called.
<se_def>*: The casino's a real draw for tourists <endash> Hic! <endash> but it's suddenly been dosed clown...er, closed down. Wonder what's going on...
<se_def>*: I'm afraid entry to the castle isn't permitted at night.<page>*: I couldn't even let you in during the day at the moment, not until Prince Charmles is found.
<se_def>*: If we don't seal up the exits like this, there's a chance he might run away.
<se_low>*: Ah-phew, ah-phew...

<se_def>*: Ooh, you gave me a fright!
What are you doing up and about so late?
<se_def>*: If you want a chat, come back and see me tomorrow. I'm off to sleep now.
<se_high>*: Zzzz...darling...

<se_low>*: What do you think you're doing!? Hic!
You can't just amble into someone else's house!
I should be entitled to some peace in my own home!
<se_low>*: I'm absolutely exhausted! I've been hunting all over the castle for the Prince all day long!
<se_low>*: At least give me a moment's quiet before bed time! Hic!
<se_high>*: Hmmm...please, dear...don't disinherit Lorenzo<...>our only son...

<se_def>*: I met my wife over in Baccarat.
The casino owner, Golding, came to our wedding, you know.
<se_high>*: I worked at the casino in Baccarat a long time ago. The owner, Mr. Golding, was ever so nice to me.
<se_high>*: I'm really worried because the casino's been shut and there are rumours he's ill and bed[-]ridden. Maybe I should go there and see how he is.
<se_high>*: ...Ah!
<se_high>*: I wasn't asleep! I was just resting my eyes!
<se_high>*: We're having a contest to see which of us can stay awake the latest! Don't tell our mum and dad, okay!?
<se_def>*: A royal mirror? I wouldn't know about something like that. You should go and ask at the castle.
<se_def>*: The royal family of Argonia are very approachable, but that doesn't mean they'll just grant every favour they're asked.

<se_def>*: But if they were in your debt somehow,
then I'm sure they'd try to grant even the most demanding of wishes.
<se_def>*: Prince Charmles tried to do a runner to Baccarat again, apparently!
<se_def>*: That's the first thing he does when he's stressed. He always turns to gambling! Sounds more like a lowlife from Pickham than a prince!
<se_def>*: There was a real hullabaloo at the castle before because Prince Charmles had gone missing. Sounds like they've found him now, though.
<se_def>*: He was probably hoping to get away while everyone was in such a fluster looking for him.
<se_def>*: But the Chancellor was quick off the mark for once, and had the exits sealed so he couldn't escape.
<se_def>*: I heard the news about Abbot Francisco at Maella Abbey being assassinated. What kind of person would kill a man of the faith like that?
<se_high>*: Wow! So there's a magic mirror in Argonia that dispels darkness!? You certainly know your stuff!
<se_high>*: Still, the royal family employ several magicians, so I suppose it stands to reason that there'd be a lot of magical things here.
<se_low>*: I haven't been able to get inside the castle up to now because Prince Charmles was causing such a stir.
<se_low>*: But I finally got in just now and managed to get hold of my permit for setting up shop during the bazaar.
<se_def>*: You can go in and out of the castle whenever you want now. Prince Charmles has been found at last, so the doors are open now.
<se_def>*: This is the entrance to Argonia Castle.
<se_def>*: The view of the town from the top of the castle is amazing, isn't it?<page>*: And it gets even better when the bazaar's on. You've never seen so much hustle and bustle!
<se_def>*: Oops! I'll be in trouble! I was supposed to be making sure Prince Charmles doesn't leave his room!

<se_def>*: He may be cowardly, but he can certainly make a quick getaway when he wants to!
He's like a liquid metal slime!
<se_def>*: It's my job to guard his room and make sure he doesn't escape.
<se_def>*: Argonia Castle opens its doors to everyone, but please make sure you behave properly when inside the castle walls.
<se_low>*: I only just heard this, but apparently there's some kind of agreement between Trodain and Argonia.<page>*: They say if a boy and girl are born in each kingdom, they have to marry!

<se_low>*: The agreement was made a long time ago,
so Prince Charmles and Princess Medea are fulfilling a vow their grandparents made.
<se_low>*: I wonder what it's like to be engaged from the minute you're born? Do you think they're happy about it?
<se_high>*: I'm supposed to be a maid, but until the other day all I was doing was looking for Prince Charmles.
<se_high>*: I thought it was a bit of a waste of time looking for him when he was probably long gone, but he was actually inside the castle all along!
<se_def>*: Can you believe that they finally found Prince Charmles hidden in a barrel, of all things!?
<se_def>*: He must be braver than we thought to endure so many days stuck in a tiny space like that!

<se_high>*: Hm? A magic mirror!?
No, I've never heard of anything like that.
<se_high>*: If you want to know about magic, you should ask one of the royal magicians. They'll probably know what it is you're talking about.
<se_def>*: I can't believe I let that no-good jester escape! I've got a feeling I'm going to regret that blunder for many a day.
<se_def>*: Well, I won't let him go when I see him next time!
<se_def>*: ...Not that I particularly want to see him again, of course. I was sure my number was up at the time.
<se_def>*: Actually, a very strange jester was here at the castle the other day. He sort of appeared out of nowhere.
<se_def>*: No one really paid him that much attention, what with all the fuss Prince Charmles was making at the time.<page>*: But it's quite a big thing that he was here, isn't it?

<se_def>*: It's my job to keep the castle safe,
so I feel bad that I wasn't more on the ball.
<se_def>*: Have you heard!? Seems Prince Charmles was so scared of doing the initiation that he hid himself in a barrel! Ridiculous, isn't it!?
<se_def>*: I bet the wedding would be off if the Princess of Trodain ever got wind of it!<page>*: ...Er, oh yeah, that was meant to be a secret! Don't tell anyone, okay!?
<se_def>*: There were a lot of messengers coming from Trodain before the royal engagement was announced.

<se_def>*: But lately there haven't been any at all.
I don't know why they've stopped coming,
but I have a bad feeling about this.
<se_def>*: What with Trodain being so far away across the ocean, it's not easy to make contact with them over there all that quickly.
<se_def>*: King Clavius's throne room is just inside. Make sure you're on your best behaviour and you don't do anything to disturb His Highness.
<se_def>*: How can we promise the Prince he'll be safe during the initiation without sending soldiers along to protect him?
<se_def>*: It's no good. I just can't see how it's possible.
<se_low>*: The King's terribly troubled at the moment because Prince Charmles refuses to carry out the initiation.<page>*: His Majesty is even considering having guards escort him.
<se_low>*: But that would hardly prove his ability to succeed to the throne. If anything, it would prove just the opposite.
<se_high>*: Lots of people have been coming to the castle to get permits for this year's bazaar.
<se_high>*: It looks like there are going to be more stalls than ever. I can hardly wait to see the town square buzzing with contented shoppers!
<se_low>*: Both King Clavius and his older brother Eltrio completed the initiation with no fear whatsoever.
<se_low>*: But Prince Charmles is such a coward, whining on about how lizards are so scary and frightening. He should be ashamed of himself!
<se_high>*: This is the chamber of the late Queen.
<se_high>*: Ever since his wife died, King Clavius has been easier than ever on Prince Charmles.

<se_def>*: If King Clavius's older brother, Eltrio,
had had a son, he'd be the one doing the
royal initiation now.
<se_def>*: But Eltrio gave up the throne and left Argonia, so leadership passed on to his younger brother.
<se_def>*: As Prince of Argonia, Charmles has no choice but to complete the royal initiation. Even though he can't stand the sight of lizards...
<se_high>*: It sounds like the Prince can't stand them, but I absolutely adore lizards. They're indispensable when it comes to black magic.
<se_high>*: It's hard for us royal magicians to understand why the Prince is so afraid of them, when we have no problems with them whatsoever.
<se_def>*: Hm? A magic mirror? Yes, I've a feeling there's something like that among the royal treasures, but I can't be sure.
<se_def>*: Even if it is here in Argonia, you'll need the King's permission if you want to borrow it, or even lay eyes on it!
<se_def>*: I love being a guard. It's great fun, and the view's amazing. The only drawback is that it can get a bit chilly out here in the wind.

<se_def>*: That's Prince Charmles's room there.
I can't help but worry that he might try
and run off again.
<se_def>*: But if you try to watch over him all the time, he moans and bawls like you wouldn't believe. Argh, this job will be the death of me!
<se_def>*: I say! Who are you? I don't believe you're members of the castle staff.
<se_def>*: How dare you enter the room of a royal prince without permission!? Do you not realise who I am!?
<se_def>Prince Charmles: Honestly! What a nerve! I could call the guards in an instant, you know!
<se_def>Prince Charmles: If you don't want to be manhandled by them, then I suggest you leave immediately!
<se_def>Prince Charmles: What are you still doing here!? You should leave now before I change my mind and stop treating you so nicely.
<se_def>Prince Charmles: I'll call the guards!
<se_def>*: The locked room in the corner houses Argonia's royal treasures.
<se_def>*: A little while back, a jester came along and broke in.
<se_def>*: He didn't take anything, which was a relief, but he did manage to get away.
<se_def>*: I doubt I'd have kept my job if he'd got hold of any treasure.
<se_def>*: ...Hm? The magic mirror?

<se_def>*: Yes, I'm sure that was still there.
Nothing was taken, like I said.
<se_def>*: I wonder why on earth that jester bothered to break in if he didn't want to take anything!?
<se_def>*: He could've easily got away with it. He could've taken his pick, in fact. It's all very odd.
<se_def>*: Huh? Magic mirror? Hic! Never heard of it!
<se_def>*: I wouldn't know about anything like that. Hic!<page>*: But if it's magic, you should try asking one of the royal magicians. Surely they'd know something... Hic!
<se_high>*: A peddler told me that Trodain has been taken over by thorns and that the whole place is in ruins!

<se_high>*: But it's all just some stupid rumour.
I'm sure it's complete nonsense really.
<se_def>*: Members of the public can only go in and out of the castle during the daytime. You'll have to come back tomorrow.

<se_def>*: This is the entrance to Argonia Castle.
You can only go inside during the daytime.
<se_def>*: When Prince Charmles caused all that fuss, the doors had to be kept locked night and day.<page>*: But that's all over now, so if you come back in the morning, I can let you in.
<se_def>*: You came here on your own boat!? Goodness! You must have money coming out of your ears to be able to afford something like that!

<se_def>*: If you've been travelling the oceans,
then maybe you've been to Trodain?
The Princess there is promised to our very own Prince Charmles.
<se_high>*: Zzzzz...
<se_low>*: Botheration! We may have found the Prince, but that still doesn't solve the problem. ...Hm!? What do you want!?
<se_low>*: I've got all sorts of problems to deal with at the moment, so the last thing I need is to be disturbed in my own home!
<se_high>*: I asked a friend of mine from the casino what happened over in Baccarat, and she said that Mr. Golding's house was broken into.<page>*: Someone was hurt, apparently.
<se_high>*: She wouldn't tell me much more, apart from that it was Mr. Golding himself who was injured. That's why he's shut himself away in his house.

<se_low>King Clavius: Unless Charmles is brought to me here,
the initiation cannot go ahead.
<se_low>King Clavius: Can you cooperate with the castle staff and find him? Oh, that troublesome son of mine!
<se_low>*: The Prince is probably still somewhere inside the castle. I've stationed guards at all the exits, so I very much doubt that he has escaped.
<se_def>*: I was holding on to the Prince's hand tightly so he wouldn't run away...
<se_def>*: But he somehow slipped out of my grasp and rushed off!
<se_high>*: I just saw one of the other politicians run by looking very pale. I wonder what was wrong with him?

<se_high>*: ...Ah, Prince Charmles has run off again.
I can't count the number of times he's done this now.
<se_high>*: If only it wasn't a lizard Prince Charmles had to fight in the initiation, I'm sure he wouldn't be quite so afraid.
<se_def>*: There seems to be an awful lot of fuss inside the castle. I wonder what's happened?

<se_def>*: Prince Charmles has run away!?
Oh no! Not again! What a pain!
<se_def>*: That Prince really is a joke sometimes. I can't imagine someone like him as our next King!
<se_def>*: Oops! I shouldn't really say things like that. Part of a guard's job is being discreet, after all. Just forget I said it.
<se_high>*: Have you heard? Apparently, they've found Prince Charmles holed up on the third floor.
<se_def>*: I tried to break down the door so that we could get at him, but it wasn't budging.

<se_def>*: There's not a lot we can do now.
That brat really is a pain sometimes!
<se_def>*: Prince Charmles shook off one of my colleagues and ran back to his room.
<se_def>*: I thought it was odd that he went so quietly in the first place. He was obviously plotting to run away again all along.

<se_def>*: Huh, I really messed up this time.
I was upstairs, so I couldn't respond quickly enough when the Prince ran away again.
<se_def>*: He wasn't in his room, so maybe he went out onto the second floor roof and crossed over to the west wing of the castle.
<se_def>*: The Prince just appeared out of nowhere and then disappeared into the west wing of the castle. I tried to catch him, but he slipped by.
<se_def>*: He's so fast, it's maddening! He might even be quicker than a liquid metal slime!
<se_def>*: I think the Prince is in there, but the door's locked so I can't get in. What is he up to!?
<se_high>*: Apparently the Prince has run off and shut himself in one of the castle rooms.

<se_high>*: At least we know where he is this time.
We had to search all over the place from dawn 'til dusk the last time he pulled this trick.
<se_low>*: I suppose I'm quite lucky, being here when Prince Charmles is causing such a fuss. It'll be a good story to tell everyone when I get home!
<se_def>*: The Prince has run off again, but we know where he is this time so there's no need to keep the castle doors locked.
<se_def>*: There's no way he'll be able to get outside this time. But he's not very gracious in admitting defeat, unfortunately.
<se_def>*: I could hardly believe my ears when I heard the Prince had run off again!

<se_def>*: He's certainly got some spirit, that one,
always trying his luck like that!
<se_def>*: Some of the others have gone to see what all the fuss is about, with Prince Charmles shutting himself away like that.
<se_def>*: But I can't leave my post, so I can't go and enjoy the show! Bit of a shame, but there you are.
<se_low>*: Prince Charmles has gone and locked himself in one of the servant's rooms now. He certainly seems determined this time.
<se_low>*: If he really hates the idea of the initiation this much, maybe the King will just have to give up on the idea.
<se_def>*: It'll take a lot to get the Prince out of that room again.
<se_def>*: I bet the only thing that'd do it would be if there was a lizard in there to scare him out!
<se_high>*: I wonder if Prince Charmles is okay?
<se_high>*: Every now and then, lizards drop from the ceiling in the room he's in, you see. I doubt he'd like that much.
<se_def>*: What am I going to do? The Prince says he'll bite his own tongue off if I try to open the door!
<se_high>*: There are lizards living in the ceiling of the room below this one. Every now and then they drop down onto the floor below.
<se_high>*: Of all the places for Prince Charmles to hide! He can't stand the sight of lizards!
<se_def>*: I don't blame the Prince for feeling the way he does.<page>*: It's a bit unfair to expect him to fight lizards when he hates them so much, initiation or not.
<se_def>*: I saw a huge one in that storeroom the other day, actually. I tried to catch it, but it got away.
<se_def>*: I wonder if it got in through a hole somewhere?
<se_def>*: It sounds like there's a bit of a commotion going on downstairs. What's happened?
<se_def>*: Of course, it had to be the Prince. I don't know why I bothered asking really. With all his nonsense, it'll be hard to keep on serving him.
<se_def>*: The Prince was just taken off by one of the soldiers, not two minutes ago!
<se_def>*: The poor thing... No doubt King Clavius will be having a few strong words to say to him in the throne room about now.
<se_high>*: I heard a terrible scream from the room below. It sounds like it must've been Prince Charmles.
<se_low>*: I do wish the Prince would know when to stop this tomfoolery, and get on with the initiation like he's supposed to.
<se_low>*: Hopefully he'll have learnt by now that trying to run away or hide just won't work. Hopefully...
<se_def>*: Poor Prince Charmles was seized by the soldiers the second he ran out of that room.
<se_def>*: And do you know what he said? That, if only it wasn't for that lizard, he could've stood at least another three days in there!

<se_high>*: When Prince Charmles ran out of that room, he was in quite the most hysterical panic!
He really must hate lizards!
<se_high>*: They caught Prince Charmles quickly this time, didn't they? Bit of a disappointment, really.
<se_high>*: I'd predicted he'd manage at least three days holed up in that room.
<se_def>*: So they've got hold of Prince Charmles again?
<se_def>*: Maybe he'll mend his ways once King Clavius has given him a good talking-to...
<se_def>*: Really!? They caught the Prince already!?
<se_def>*: They won't keep hold of him long! He's got spirit, that one. He'll be off again before you know it!
<se_def>*: Did you know about the wasteland across the sea to the northwest of here? Nobody lives there.
<se_def>*: People say that the shrine in the middle of it is filled with the darkest powers in the world.
<se_def>*: It's a place everyone's been going to for years to perform dark rites, apparently.<page>*: Well, the kind of people who go in for that sort of thing, I mean.

<se_def>*: I wish my shift would hurry up and end.
I've got to go and see where the Prince has shut himself up.<page>*: Wouldn't miss the drama for the world!
<se_def>*: What!? He's already come out!?

<se_def>*: Oh, of all the rotten luck!
I was looking forward to a good show...
<se_def>*: It fills me with courage when I look at Prince Charmles.
<se_def>*: It's nice to know there's someone out there more cowardly than me, you see! He makes me look good!
<se_def>*: The Prince was caught just now. I bet King Clavius is giving him a real dressing down!
<se_def>*: The Prince has been caught, but I doubt he'll be coming back to his room for a while.
<se_def>*: I doubt the King will let him off the hook this time. He'll have to agree to the initiation before he's allowed to go free again.
<se_def>*: DUMMY MES!
<se_def>*: DUMMY MES!
